perturbation.original_text:
Within thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company
to, furnish to Skype complete and accurate statements (each, a “Statement”) in a form acceptable to Skype, certified to be accurate by an officer of
the Company or Online BVI, as applicable, showing with reasonable detail (i) the Gross Revenue actually received and collected by the Company or
Online BVI, or if applicable, any Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of Tom Holding), licensee,
distributor or reseller thereof, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, (ii) the Direct Expenses incurred thereby, during the
preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, and (iii) the calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.changed_text:
Within ninety (90) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company
to, furnish to Skype complete and accurate statements (each, a “Statement”) in a form acceptable to Skype, certified to be accurate by an officer of
the Company or Online BVI, as applicable, showing with reasonable detail (i) the Gross Revenue actually received and collected by the Company or
Online BVI, or if applicable, any Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of Tom Holding), licensee,
distributor or reseller thereof, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, (ii) the Direct Expenses incurred thereby, during the
preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, and (iii) the calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.explanation: Increasing the time frame for providing statements from 30 to 90 days may create non-compliance issues. Many jurisdictions have laws requiring timely and accurate financial reporting.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting Standards and Company Law of PRC

perturbation.original_text:
Provided that the respective Parties utilize their best efforts to provide such payments together with the respective Statements, no
Party shall be deemed in breach hereof for delivering late payment until the date which is sixty (60) days following the last day of the respective
applicable calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text:
Provided that the respective Parties utilize their best efforts to provide such payments together with the respective Statements, no
Party shall be deemed in breach hereof for delivering late payment until the date which is one hundred and eighty (180) days following the last day of the respective
applicable calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Extending the late payment period to 180 days could conflict with regulations mandating shorter payment terms to protect businesses, particularly small or medium-sized enterprises, from cash flow issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, Payment Regulations in PRC.

perturbation.original_text:
The Parties agree to provide such further information relating to Adjusted Net Revenue as may be reasonably available and as may be
reasonably requested by the other Parties by giving 14 days’ prior written notice to the relevant Party from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Parties agree to provide such further information relating to Adjusted Net Revenue as may be reasonably available and as may be
reasonably requested by the other Parties by giving 2 days’ prior written notice to the relevant Party from time to time.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for providing additional financial information to just 2 days may not comply with legal or regulatory requirements for adequate notice, especially if the information requires significant time to compile or review.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting Standards and Company Law of PRC
